  18.   {b Warning:} this module is unstable and part of
  19.   {{!Compiler_libs}compiler-libs}.

  21. *)

  23. ‌val implementation : Lexing.lexbuf -> Parsetree.structure
  24. ‌val interface : Lexing.lexbuf -> Parsetree.signature

  31. ‌val module_expr : Lexing.lexbuf -> Parsetree.module_expr

  33. (** The functions below can be used to parse Longident safely. *)

  35. ‌val longident: Lexing.lexbuf -> Longident.t
  36. (**
  37.    The function [longident] is guaranteed to parse all subclasses
  38.    of {!Longident.t} used in OCaml: values, constructors, simple or extended
  39.    module paths, and types or module types.

  41.    However, this function accepts inputs which are not accepted by the
  42.    compiler, because they combine functor applications and infix operators.
  43.    In valid OCaml syntax, only value-level identifiers may end with infix
  44.    operators [Foo.( + )].
  45.    Moreover, in value-level identifiers the module path [Foo] must be simple
  46.    ([M.N] rather than [F(X)]): functor applications may only appear in
  47.    type-level identifiers.
  48.    As a consequence, a path such as [F(X).( + )] is not a valid OCaml
  49.    identifier; but it is accepted by this function.
  50. *)

  52. (** The next functions are specialized to a subclass of {!Longident.t} *)

  54. ‌val val_ident: Lexing.lexbuf -> Longident.t
  55. (**
  56.    This function parses a syntactically valid path for a value. For instance,
  57.    [x], [M.x], and [(+.)] are valid. Contrarily, [M.A], [F(X).x], and [true]
  58.    are rejected.

  60.    Longident for OCaml's value cannot contain functor application.
  61.    The last component of the {!Longident.t} is not capitalized,
  62.    but can be an operator [A.Path.To.(.%.%.(;..)<-)]
  63. *)

  65. ‌val constr_ident: Lexing.lexbuf -> Longident.t
  66. (**
  67.    This function parses a syntactically valid path for a variant constructor.
  68.    For instance, [A], [M.A] and [M.(::)] are valid, but both [M.a]
  69.    and [F(X).A] are rejected.

  71.    Longident for OCaml's variant constructors cannot contain functor
  72.    application.
  73.    The last component of the {!Longident.t} is capitalized,
  74.    or it may be one the special constructors: [true],[false],[()],[[]],[(::)].
  75.    Among those special constructors, only [(::)] can be prefixed by a module
  76.    path ([A.B.C.(::)]).
  77. *)


  80. ‌val simple_module_path: Lexing.lexbuf -> Longident.t
  81. (**
  82.    This function parses a syntactically valid path for a module.
  83.    For instance, [A], and [M.A] are valid, but both [M.a]
  84.    and [F(X).A] are rejected.

  86.    Longident for OCaml's module cannot contain functor application.
  87.    The last component of the {!Longident.t} is capitalized.
  88. *)


  91. ‌val extended_module_path: Lexing.lexbuf -> Longident.t
  92. (**
  93.    This function parse syntactically valid path for an extended module.
  94.    For instance, [A.B] and [F(A).B] are valid. Contrarily,
  95.    [(.%())] or [[]] are both rejected.

  97.    The last component of the {!Longident.t} is capitalized.

  99. *)

  101. ‌val type_ident: Lexing.lexbuf -> Longident.t
  102. (**
  103.    This function parse syntactically valid path for a type or a module type.
  104.    For instance, [A], [t], [M.t] and [F(X).t] are valid. Contrarily,
  105.    [(.%())] or [[]] are both rejected.

  107.    In path for type and module types, only operators and special constructors
  108.    are rejected.

  110. *)
